title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

08:25 <vinzzzz> has quit  
08:32 <vmassol> cjdelisle: good morning. We should make this script available directly in the wiki. Same as we did with the Blog migration. It needs to be easy for users somehow. We need to find a way for users to discover this script from the wiki too  
08:34 <ihalip> has joined #xwiki  
08:34 <ihalip> has quit  
08:34 <ihalip> has joined #xwiki  
08:34 <vmassol> also imagine having to run this on all subwikis on myxwiki.org for example…. a real pain...  
08:34 <vmassol> I think we need to brainstorm on the migration srategy  
08:35 <cjdelisle> yea, it can be fixed to do many wikis simultaniously. It's just another for loop.  
08:48 <Avipar> has joined #xwiki  
09:13 <cjdelisle> After filesystem attachments are widely deployed, there will be no advantage to storing images and icons in the /resources/ directory.  
09:14 <ihalip> has quit  
09:14 <vmassol> well you mean after FS is widely deployed AND performant :)  
09:14 <cjdelisle> Oh?  
09:14 <vmassol> right now it takes a lot longer to upload an attachment  
09:14 <vmassol> than to put it on the FS  
09:15 <vmassol> at least x2 (without counting the upload time)  
09:15 <vmassol> but yes that's a good point  
09:15 <cjdelisle> Sure but you don't routinely upload the files in the /resources/ directory.  
09:15 <vmassol> hmmm  
09:15 <vmassol> an issue is possibly the disk space  
09:16 <vmassol> but probably not  
09:16 <vmassol> (since they can have revs)  
09:16 <vmassol> (they're not that large)  
09:16 <vmassol> ah  
09:16 <vmassol> there's one difference  
09:16 <cjdelisle> They are forced to have revs. That was not my design, I copied it.  
09:16 <cjdelisle> (at least one revision)  
09:17 <vmassol> hmm no forget that  
09:17 <vmassol> the only diff is that right now resources are considerd system resources  
09:17 <vmassol> not user data  
09:17 <cjdelisle> If I ever get around to writing an attachment cache then using skin files will actually be detrimental to performance.  
09:17 <vmassol> so for ex when you back up you want to backup your user data  
09:18 <vmassol> and not the system data  
09:18 <vmassol> (especially since you want to use the next version's system data when you upgrade)  
09:19 <vmassol> but this is the same for documents  
09:19 <vmassol> so with a good extension manager it could work fine  
09:19 <vmassol> it means bringing more stuff to the user space  
09:19 <cjdelisle> Perhaps attachments in a given space are ignored (on big systems anyway)  
09:21 <cjdelisle> If the problem is about resource consumption then it can be mitigated my backing things up using delta compression.  
09:21 <cjdelisle> Then you backup the system data only once.  
09:23 <cjdelisle> http://cm.bell-labs.com/cm/cs/who/dmr/odd.html

10:11 <+sburjan> I want to create or to start creating documentation for dashboards, but I don't know the perfect place to put it  
10:14 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: what's the best way to test for null and only null in our velocity scripts?  
10:15 <+mflorea> nulltool doesn't seem to be available. I'd have to use:  
10:15 <+mflorea> #if ((! $var) && ("$!var" == ""))  
10:15 <+mflorea> Anything shorter?  
10:17 <+tmortagne> $var can be boolean false ?  
10:18 <+tmortagne> if it's a string then !var should do it  
10:18 <+tmortagne> !$var  
10:18 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <+mflorea> it can be false, I have configuration properties that can have string, integer or boolean value and I want to know if they are set or not.  
10:35 <evalica> has quit  
10:38 <sdumitriu> has quit  
10:43 <arkub\_> has joined #xwiki  
10:44 <arkub> has quit  
10:44 <+tmortagne> mflorea: ok  
10:45 <+tmortagne> did you tried $var == $xwiki.null ?  
10:45 <+tmortagne> never tried something like that  
10:47 <+tmortagne> seems to work well  
10:47 <+tmortagne> but it's not very nice having to use $xwiki  
10:48 <+tmortagne> actually should do it with any not defined variable  
10:48 <vmassol> yes it shouldn't be used ($xwiki.null)  
10:48 <+tmortagne>  #if ($var == $null)  
10:48 <+tmortagne> that works well  
10:48 <vmassol> that's dangerous tthomas  
10:48 <+tmortagne> $null or any name you know is not defined  
10:48 <vmassol> if someone defines $null  
10:48 <vmassol> that looks very very magical  
10:49 <+tmortagne> mflorea said he wanted something short not something not magical ;)  
10:49 <vmassol> :)  
10:49 <+tmortagne> a pitty there is nothing in velocity for null  
10:49 <+tmortagne> or maybe there is now  
10:50 <+mflorea> there is http://wiki.apache.org/velocity/NullTool  
10:51 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:51 <+tmortagne> we should add this tool if we don't have it already then  
10:52 <vmassol> first we should check if it's stil required in velocity 1.7  
10:52 <+tmortagne> can't find anything in the velocity guide  
10:52 <+tmortagne> s/guide/user guide:  
10:52 <vmassol> ok  
10:53 <vmassol> is it bundled in any jar? (this null tool)  
10:53 <vmassol> we need to upgrade to velocity tools 2.0 btw  
10:53 <+tmortagne> insn't it in velocity tools ? maybe in the 2.0 yes  
10:54 <vmassol> http://velocity.apache.org/tools/releases/2.0/generic.html  
10:54 <vmassol> doesn't seem to be ther  
10:54 <vmassol> there  
10:54 <+tmortagne> indeed  
10:54 <vmassol> so we'll need to add it to our sources  
10:55 <vmassol> (ie recode it to avoid license issues)  
10:55 <+tmortagne> checking the jar to be sure  
10:55 <vmassol> (don't look at the code marius guys!)  
10:55 <vmassol> (otherwise it'll be copy and not rewrite ;))  
10:56 <+tmortagne> it's not in http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/velocity/tools/trunk/velocity-tools-generic/src/main/java/org/apache/velocity/tools/generic/  
10:57 <vmassol> reading https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VELOCITY-531  
10:57 <+tmortagne> which i find weird since it seems usefull  
10:57 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:57 <vmassol> let's check their jira  
10:58 <+tmortagne> https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VELOCITY-186  
10:58 <+tmortagne> ha that's something else  
10:59 <+tmortagne> it just for set to take into account null  
10:59 <+tmortagne> but nothing like a null syntax  
10:59 <vmassol> https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=project+%3D+VELOCITY+AND+%28summary+~+%22NULL%22+OR+description+~+%22NULL%22+OR+comment+~+%22NULL%22%29

11:02 <vmassol> nothing

11:03 <vmassol> creating jira

11:06 <vmassol> https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VELTOOLS-139

11:07 <+mflorea> yep  
11:09 <vmassol> but indeed we should check why we need to check for null  
11:09 <vmassol> there could be better ways

11:56 <vmassol> sburjan: well new videos need to be created actually and old ones removed

11:57 <vmassol> you can as a quick fix only

11:58 <vmassol> yes  
11:58 <+sburjan> ok. compacting  
11:59 <+sburjan> I want to create Dashboards documentation, but I can't find the perfect place for it  
12:00 <vmassol> sburjan: i could help you but I need to finish fixing a bug first and then lunch, so after lunch  
12:00 <vmassol> (actuzaly I have to run some errands just after lunch so a bit later)  
12:00 <+sburjan> okay  
12:00 <vmassol> (but don't wait for me, others can help too ;))  
12:00 <+sburjan> I know that  
12:00 <+sburjan> Just waiting for their suggestions :)  
12:00 <vmassol> well best is that your porpose something  
12:01 <vmassol> otherwise you're putting all the onus on them  
12:01 <vmassol> and since you're the master documenter you should know xwiki.org by heart by  now  
12:01 <vmassol> :)  
12:01 <vmassol> so you're the expert!  
12:01 <+sburjan> ok  
12:01 <+sburjan> ;)  
12:01 <vmassol> just remember to separate  
12:01 <vmassol> platform features from application features  
12:02 <+sburjan> well that's the thing, dashboards isn't an application, it's in XE. and XE is neither platform neither application :)

13:14 <vmassol>     public static final String PATTERN = ".\*" + System.getProperty("pattern", "");

13:15 <vmassol> yes

13:16 <vmassol> so you cannot do that from the command line  
13:16 <vmassol> but it's easy from your ide

13:35 <jamesxu> hi I have a question about xwiki editor, I know WYSIWYG editor are implemented using GWT, what is the technology for xwiki editor, is GWT too?  
13:36 <vmassol> jamesxu: nope it's a simple html textarea  
13:36 <vmassol> (if you're talking about the wiki editor)  
13:37 <jamesxu> Yes, I am talking about the wiki editor  
13:38 <jamesxu> If I want to add auto-suggestion features for xwiki editor, should I use other javascript tools like jquery, prototype or dojo?  
13:38 <vmassol> prototype I guess but sdumitriu, jvelociter would be better devs to help you… I don't know too much about js  
13:39 <jamesxu> ok, thanks all the same~~~  
13:39 <@sdumitriu> prototype, with scriptaculous if needed, but I'd rather keep it to prototype only  
13:41 <jamesxu> Ok, so what version of prototype should be used?  
13:41 <@sdumitriu> 1.7  
13:41 <@sdumitriu> The one already present in the sources  
13:42 <jamesxu> ok, thanks very much, I get it now~~~  
13:42 <@sdumitriu> https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/web/trunk/standard/src/main/webapp/resources/js/prototype/  
13:43 <jamesxu> Thanks~~~

14:43 <@sdumitriu> sburjan: No, it should not be listed, but it's normal not to have a parent  
14:43 <@sdumitriu> It's the root

14:45 <@sdumitriu> That's a simple demo script  
14:46 <@sdumitriu> It's not supposed to be perfect

14:47 <vmassol> tmortagne: I don't know off the top of my head. Would need to read the code again re livetable and ui tests, it's possible there's a bug

14:50 <vmassol> sburjan: we have a query guide page for xwql with examples

14:51 <vmassol> it's not important

15:28 <+sburjan> vmassol: may I ask what is happening here ? http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise27RC1  
15:29 <+sburjan> this redirects me to the ReleaseNotes space  
15:29 <+sburjan> yet it's still listed as orphan in Main space  
15:29 <+sburjan> what is making the redirect ?  
15:29 <vmassol> hehe  
15:29 <vmassol> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise27RC1  
15:30 <+sburjan> this is odd :)  
15:30 <vmassol> odd?  
15:30 <vmassol> it's our manual rename feature  
15:30 <vmassol> to not break external links  
15:31 <+sburjan> other release noted don't have that :)  
15:31 <vmassol> yep  
15:32 <+sburjan> so where is the actualy page ? in Main or ReleaseNotes ? cos I can't figure it out  
15:32 <vmassol> there are 2 pages  
15:32 <vmassol> one in main redirecting to the one in ReleaseNotes  
15:32 <+sburjan> understood :)  
15:34 <+sburjan> I guess the same mechanism we wanted for Main/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise18M2 too. But this is clearly broken  
15:35 <+sburjan> IMO we should remove redirects and don't do that in future  
15:35 <+sburjan> with ReleaseNotes  
15:35 <+sburjan> they have their own space  
15:37 <+sburjan> maybe you could help me fix those 2  
15:39 <vmassol> sburjan: don't remove them please  
15:39 <vmassol> they've been added for a good reason  
15:39 <vmassol> it's not done at random  
15:39 <+sburjan> ok  
15:39 <vmassol> I've added them whenever they were required  
15:39 <+sburjan> but IMO it is not consistent with the other release notes pages  
15:39 <vmassol> nothing to do with consistency here  
15:39 <vmassol> I've added them when there were important external links pointing to them  
15:40 <+sburjan> oh, I see  
15:40 <vmassol> and we needed to ensure they were not broken  
15:40 <vmassol> the fix is to support this in the core platform but we're not there yet  
15:41 <+sburjan> I haven't removed any  
15:41 <+sburjan> but the one to 1.8 is shown as broken/non existing page..

21:34 <cjdelisle> Something I've been thinking about is the setter/getter pattern for entity storage.  
21:34 <cjdelisle> I would like it if everything that came out of the database was immutable.  
21:34 <cjdelisle> The best way to do that is to make it final but that ruins the idea of using setters.  
21:36 <cjdelisle> If EG an XWikiDocument which came from the db were immutable then we wouldn't have to worry about cache poisoning or synchronizing on save.  
21:58 <cjdelisle> on first page load, 99 documents are cloned.  
21:58 <vmassol> I bet most of these are from XWikiPReferences doc  
21:58 <cjdelisle> second page, only 19  
21:59 <cjdelisle> interesting re hibernate ogm. Still trying to figure out were they say what storage it supports, that is a bad sign.  
22:00 <cjdelisle> http://pastebay.com/118743  
22:00 <cjdelisle> there's the list  
22:01 <cjdelisle> first page is Main.WebHome, second is Sandbox.WebHome  
22:02 <cjdelisle> load Main.WebHome again, 26 pages that time.  
22:11 <cjdelisle>     private EntityReferenceSerializer<String> localEntityReferenceSerializer = Utils.getComponent(  
22:11 <cjdelisle>         EntityReferenceSerializer.class, "local");  
22:11 <cjdelisle> How are those intended to work in the end (in XWikiDocument)  
22:12 <cjdelisle> given that Utils.getComponent is not a long term solution but a backward compatability hack.  
22:12 <cjdelisle> It seems to suggest that each document will need to be filtered through a dependency injection system.  
22:14 <pulasthi> has quit  
22:15 <vmassol> I don't understand the question  
22:15 <abusenius> has quit  
22:16 <vmassol> all components are supposed to be injected  
22:16 <cjdelisle> So an XWikiDocument will eventually become a component?  
22:16 <vmassol> no  
22:16 <vmassol> well  
22:17 <vmassol> I understand what you mean now  
22:17 <vmassol> it's yet to be decided  
22:17 <vmassol> but yes it could well be a perlookup component  
22:17 <cjdelisle> For me, I don't like it.  
22:17 <vmassol> it'll need access to services  
22:17 <vmassol> it makes sense that it is a perlookup component indeed  
22:18 <cjdelisle> XWD already has way too much expansion of scope.  
22:18 <vmassol> you should read the thread  
22:18 <vmassol> on the devs list  
22:18 <vmassol> about rich model vs anemic model  
22:18 <cjdelisle> I did. I still don't think that's valid in this case.  
22:19 <cjdelisle> XWD is a god object.  
22:19 <vmassol> it's \*\*exactly\*\* this use case  
22:19 <cjdelisle> 7,745 lines? When will it end?  
22:19 <vmassol> errr?  
22:19 <cjdelisle> length of XWikiDocument.java  
22:19 <vmassol> we're not tlaking about the same thing  
22:19 <vmassol> you're talking about the current impl  
22:20 <vmassol> and I'm talking about the new model  
22:20 <cjdelisle> You are going to remove XWikiDocument from the new model?  
22:20 <vmassol> in the new model it'll be something like 500 lines  
22:20 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
22:21 <cjdelisle> IMO put one foot in front of the other. Removing XWikiDocument is a massive task, it is used everywhere.  
22:22 <vmassol> why do you want to remove it?  
22:22 <vmassol> I don't get it  
22:22 <vmassol> who said anything about removing it?  
22:22 <vmassol> :)  
22:22 <vmassol> the strategy I highlighted in these mails  
22:22 <vmassol> is not to remove it  
22:22 <vmassol> but to write a new model  
22:22 <cjdelisle> Ok so you mean to pear it down by deprectaion and removal until it is 500 lines?  
22:24 <cjdelisle> I don't remember things that well (IE mailing list threads) but I seem to recall the "replace and remove" pattern was the chosen path.  
22:24 <rstavro> has joined #xwiki  
22:24 <vmassol> first step would be http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/contrib/sandbox/xwiki-model/  
22:24 <vmassol> http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/contrib/sandbox/xwiki-model/xwiki-model-bridge/  
22:25 <cjdelisle> http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/contrib/sandbox/xwiki-model/xwiki-model-api/src/main/java/org/xwiki/model/Document.java  
22:25 <cjdelisle> ^replace and remove?  
22:25 <vmassol> this is a new api it doesn't remove anything  
22:25 <vmassol> interface  
22:26 <cjdelisle> But you don't intend for XWikiDocument to actually last forever right?  
22:26 <vmassol> correct  
22:26 <vmassol> the second step is to have a new impleentation for the interfaces  
22:26 <vmassol> using JCR or something else  
22:26 <cjdelisle> Has that pattern worked before?  
22:27 <vmassol> the third step is to offer a config switch  to choose the implementation to use  
22:27 <vmassol> the fourth step is to move out the old model impl  
22:28 <cjdelisle> Actually, captcha is an example of that pattern working, except that unlike XWikiDocument, jcaptcha plugin degraded to uselessness and was used by practically nobody so it was actually new functionality.  
22:29 <vmassol> if you have a better idea please raise it on the list so that we can discuss it  
22:30 <cjdelisle> I don't know if trying to drag old classes and interfaces into the 21 century is a better idea or not because I don't have much information on whether "replace and remove" (as I call it) has worked before on a large scale.  
22:32 <vmassol> what I know for sure is that rewrite has failed a LOT for people who tried it  
22:32 <cjdelisle> rewrite meaning to pick away at old classes and try to make them new again?  
22:33 <vmassol> rewrite means to start again from scratch and throw away the old code  
22:33 <vmassol> which in practice means 2 branches  
22:33 <cjdelisle> Yes, that sounds like a very big gamble.  
22:34 <vmassol> the strategy I have followed so far is:  
22:34 <vmassol> - slim down XWiki and XWikiDocument by moving out domains that are not related to the model  
22:35 <vmassol> - when all that's left is the model do what we mentioned above  
22:35 <vmassol> there are still quite a few domains to move out  
22:35 <cjdelisle> +1 for slimming down. Even if we do replace & remove after it will make the interfaces more compatable when the change comes.  
22:35 <vmassol> one thing we need to do btw is remove all deprecated methods in the backward compat aspects and xwiki-legacy module and then remove completely after some time  
22:36 <vmassol> s/remove/move/  
22:36 <vmassol> we've not been applying this diligently  
22:37 <vmassol> (not always easy since it means fixing all places using the deprecated code to use the new way)  
22:37 <vmassol> for ex we still have quite a lot of places using String and not Entity References  
22:37 <cjdelisle> I like spotting code that is unused and then breaking it before someone comes along and uses it.  
22:38 <vmassol> so we cannot yet remove get/set methods that take a string in XWikiDocument  
22:38 <vmassol> that would remove a lot of them  
22:38 <vmassol> actually right now with the introduction of Entity Refernce we've increased the size of XWikiDocument ;)  
22:39 <cjdelisle> I know, when I scanned for unused code I kept running in to them.  
22:39 <vmassol> our problem is that we don't spend a lot of time working on reducing our techincal debt in each release  
22:40 <vmassol> we spend some time but not nearly enough compared to the work that has to be done  
22:40 <vmassol> the tech debt is huge  
22:40 <cjdelisle> Features are fun.  
22:40 <vmassol> yeah that too although I don't feel we're too feature-oriented as a dev team  
22:41 <vmassol> but we do spend a huge amount of time fixing old stuff  
22:41 <vmassol> when we would globally spend less time by having worked on removing them  
22:41 <vmassol> (but it's harder to do and takes time)  
22:41 <cjdelisle> OTOH when old stuff is constantly breaking...  
22:42 <cjdelisle> c.x.x.api.Document is a very nice class, it might be the ticket to removing XWikiDocument.  
22:42 <cjdelisle> If you can back c.x.x.api.Document with something else then most legacy scripting will be happy with you.  
22:43 <cjdelisle> Then there is nothing keeping XWikiDocument from being removed.  
22:43 <cjdelisle> (of course it's a very large value of 'nothing')  
22:44 <vmassol> I wouldn't call Document api nice….  
22:44 <cjdelisle> It may not be what we want but imagine the horror if XWikiDocument were exposed to velocity script.  
22:44 <cjdelisle> We would be imprisoned with no way out.  
22:45 <vmassol> well it almost is  
22:45 <rstavro> has left #xwiki  
22:46 <vmassol> and Document keeps growing whenever there's a need in scripting  
22:46 <cjdelisle> We are not tough enough on new API.  
22:46 <vmassol> except when we are able to create a new module and use the new $services api  
22:46 <vmassol> you cannot be tough  
22:46 <vmassol> but we can do it properly  
22:47 <vmassol> remember that xwiki is not a wiki!  
22:47 <vmassol> it's a development platform  
22:47 <cjdelisle> Indeed. Wiki has become quite a misnomer.  
22:47 <vmassol> so you cannot say no to something that should be available to scripting  
22:48 <vmassol> but you can properly isoltae it in its own domain exposed through $services  
22:48 <cjdelisle> Well, I suppose things should be available as extensions.  
22:48 <vmassol> exactly  
22:48 <vmassol> that's the $services model  
22:49 <vmassol> it's completely dynamic  
22:49 <cjdelisle> Without extensions anything anyone needs is forced on everyone until the jvm 10GB of premgen space.  
22:49 <cjdelisle> \*needs  
22:50 <vmassol> yes the idea is to move stuff out of core and make them extensions, that's what we started doing since 2007  
22:50 <vmassol> it's just slow  
22:51 <vmassol> we'e really missing IX to make that happen for UI though….

22:52 <vmassol> + api to get others
